ygData.subject: Male vs. Female Characters
ygData.msgSnippet: Janice, I love how your characters have such distinctive, fun and interesting personalities. I m not exactly sure what my character (Guerrilla on Tuneare) s
ygData.messageBody:
Janice,

I love how your characters have such distinctive, fun and interesting
personalities. I'm not exactly sure what my character (Guerrilla on
Tuneare) 's personality is yet. I guess I'm developing it, but you've given
me some good food for thought.

I've met mostly nice and only a few rude characters on line. More of the
rude ones tend to be male characters and I suspect that the rude ones,
whether their characters are male or female, in RL are probably those 13
year old males you mentioned. Two of the nicest female characters are my
guild sisters and they are for sure female in RL. What I've noticed about
EQ characters, both female and mostly male, is that some are very selfish
and obnoxious. They are impatient and lead their comrades into dangerous
places too often. They take more than their share of the loot. And they
never say thank you. Somehow I think that most of these characters are
young males in RL, but they could be older (some people never grow up) or
female (good and bad are not limited by gender).

I chose to play a female to begin with on EQ because I figured I would have
enough to learn about the game environment and my race/class without having
to worry about role playing a gender I'm less familiar with than my own.
Perhaps later I'll try a male character and see how it works. Do any of you
real women every play male characters? Do you recommend it and if so why?

On Thursday, June 17, 1999 3:16 AM, Janice [SMTP:jcjc@...] wrote:
> From: "Janice" <jcjc@...>
>
> Hello Everyone,
>
> It has been a long night of fighting orcs and watching the beautiful
unicorn
> in Lesser so I will keep this short.
>
> My girls all live on Bristlebane and they are:
>
> Bitty lvl 3 halfling Druid -- However, Bitty has had a head injury and
does
> not acknowledge she is a Druid, she believes she is a pirate and that
> someone has stolen her ship, The Miss Lady Red Toes. Please be kind to
her,
> she is quite insane.
>
> Garnet lvl 7 human Ranger -- A bit tough but has a good heart but, shhhh,
> don't tell that to anyone.
>
> Honi lvl 6 human Bard -- Honi was named for her sweet voice and
> disposition.
>
> Ivory lvl 6 high elf Cleric -- Ivory is a tailor as well as a healer.
Quiet
> but good at her job.
>
> Kachine lvl 12 human Monk -- Very shy, Kachine is to be married to
Mondre, a
> 15th level Cleric.
>
> Zuzu lvl 9 troll Warrior -- Zuzu also has some mental problems but we
don't
> mention them to her because we don't want to get "barshed on de hed".
She
> is convinced she is beautiful and boasts about it on a regular basis.
She
> thinks she has won some sort of beauty contest to prove it but, when
> questioned about it, she changes the subject with song or threats of
> barshing. She also thinks she is always right.
>
> So, there you have it, my girls. If you are ever on Bristlebane, take a
> moment and say hello. Another female and I were discussing how difficult
it
> is to make female friends on our server. We have both encountered many
rude
> female chars. and it was beyond role-play. I told her I felt most were
13
> year old males, lol. Seriously though, she and I have talked about this
and
> would like some input regarding the subject. Do you find this on the
other
> servers? I love my male friends dearly but, come on, we all need a
little
> girl-talk now and then, don't we? I am looking forward to some feedback
on
> this.
>
> Well, so much for short. Glad to be here on the list with all of you.
>
> Janice
>
>
